title: Carver Ranches, West Park, Florida
text:
Carver Ranches was a <a href="census-designated%20place">census-designated place</a> (CDP) in <a href="Broward%20County%2C%20Florida">Broward County</a>, <a href="Florida">Florida</a>, United States. The population was 4,299 at the 2000 census.
In 2005 it became one of four neighborhoods to <a href="municipality">incorporate</a> into the new <a href="city">city</a> of <a href="West%20Park%2C%20Florida">West Park</a>.
Geography.
Carver Ranches is located at (25.991718, -80.191716).
According to the <a href="United%20States%20Census%20Bureau">United States Census Bureau</a>, the CDP has a total area of 1.7 km2 (0.7 mi2), all land.
Demographics.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, there were 4,299 people, 1,340 households, and 1,027 families residing in the CDP. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 2,477.4/km2 (6,376.5/mi2). There were 1,428 housing units at an average density of 822.9/km2 (2,118.1/mi2). The racial makeup of the CDP was 2.19% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a> (1.4% were Non-Hispanic White,) 96.42% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.16% <a href="Native%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Native American</a>, 0.02% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 0.56% from <a href="Race%20%28United%20States%20Census%29">other races</a>, and 0.65% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 1.65% of the population.
There were 1,340 households, out of which 33.8% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 36.0% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 33.7% had a female householder with no husband present, and 23.3% were non-families. 18.5% of all households were made up of individuals, and 6.3% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.20 and the average family size was 3.62.
In the CDP, the population was spread out, with 32.3% under the age of 18, 8.7% from 18 to 24, 28.1% from 25 to 44, 19.4% from 45 to 64, and 11.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 32 years. For every 100 females, there were 85.5 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 82.2 males.
The median income for a household in the CDP was $26,613, and the median income for a family was $27,412. Males had a median income of $22,604 versus $21,213 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the CDP was $10,090. About 25.6% of families and 25.3% of the population were below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including 31.5% of those under age 18 and 36.4% of those age 65 or over.
As of 2000, before being <a href="annexation%23Subnational%20annexation">annex</a>ed to West Park, <a href="English%20language">English</a> as a <a href="first%20language">first language</a> accounted for 96.90% of all residents, while <a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a> accounted for 2.19%, and <a href="Haitian%20Creole">French Creole</a> as a <a href="mother%20tongue">mother tongue</a> made up 0.90% of the population.
